definitions: nocturnal flying mammal with webbed wings and echolocation abilities
wooden or metal club used to hit balls in sports
examples: Bats emerge from the cave at dusk to hunt insects
The fruit bat hung upside down from the tree branch
He gripped the baseball bat and prepared to swing
She bought a new cricket bat for the season

definitions: advancement to a higher position or rank in an organization
publicity campaign to increase sales or awareness of a product
examples: Her promotion to senior manager came after years of dedication
The promotion included a significant salary increase
The store's promotion offered fifty percent off selected items
They launched an aggressive promotion for the new product

definitions: state of being uncertain or not knowing what will happen
examples: Economic uncertainty made investors hesitant to commit funds
She faced the uncertainty of the future with courage

definitions: legal right or state of possessing something
examples: Home ownership remains a primary goal for many families
The ownership of the company transferred to new investors

definitions: small piece of material attached to identify or describe something
children's game where one player chases others to touch them
examples: Check the price tag before purchasing the item
The luggage tag helped identify her suitcase
The children played tag in the playground after school
You're it! she shouted during their game of tag

definitions: film or television program presenting facts about real events or people
examples: The nature documentary showcased rare wildlife footage
They watched a documentary about climate change

definitions: main structural part of a plant supporting leaves and flowers
root or main part of a word to which affixes are added
examples: The rose stem was covered with sharp thorns
Cut the stems before placing flowers in the vase
The word 'running' has 'run' as its stem
Understanding word stems helps with vocabulary building

definitions: overflow of water that submerges land that is usually dry
examples: The flood destroyed homes along the river bank
Emergency crews evacuated residents before the flood arrived

definitions: feeling of having done wrong or failed in an obligation
examples: Guilt consumed him after lying to his parents
She carried the guilt of that decision for years

definitions: inner side or part of something enclosed
examples: The inside of the house was beautifully decorated
Store the medicine inside a cool, dry cabinet

definitions: device that makes a loud sound as a warning or signal
sudden feeling of fear or anxiety about danger
examples: The smoke alarm woke everyone in the middle of night
Set your alarm for six o'clock tomorrow morning
She felt alarm when she noticed someone following her
The news caused widespread alarm among investors

definitions: large bird native to North America, often eaten at holiday meals
country located between Europe and Asia
examples: They roasted a turkey for Thanksgiving dinner
Wild turkeys roamed through the forest
Turkey bridges two continents with its unique location
Istanbul is the largest city in Turkey

definitions: manner in which a person behaves, especially professionally
organization and carrying out of a particular activity
examples: Professional conduct is expected in the workplace
The student's conduct improved throughout the semester
The conduct of the experiment followed strict protocols
She will conduct the orchestra at tonight's performance

definitions: condition of being physically fit and healthy through exercise
examples: Regular exercise improves overall fitness and well-being
The fitness center offers various classes and equipment

definitions: large area of sea partially enclosed by land
deep difference or division between people or ideas
examples: Oil tankers crossed the Persian Gulf daily
The Gulf of Mexico supports a rich marine ecosystem
A gulf exists between their political views
The gulf between rich and poor continues to widen

definitions: informal or childish word for mother
examples: The toddler reached for mommy when scared
Mommy, can we go to the park today?

definitions: act of giving up something valued for something else regarded as more important
examples: Parents make many sacrifices for their children's education
The sacrifice of personal time paid off professionally

definitions: entire range of wavelengths of electromagnetic radiation or broad range of related ideas
examples: The visible spectrum includes all colors from red to violet
Political views fall across a wide spectrum of beliefs

definitions: legendary creature typically depicted as a large reptile breathing fire
examples: The dragon guarded its treasure in the mountain cave
Chinese dragons symbolize power and good fortune

definitions: microscopic single-celled organisms that can be beneficial or cause disease
examples: Bacteria in yogurt aid digestion and gut health
Antibiotics help fight harmful bacteria causing infections

definitions: land along the edge of a sea, lake, or river
examples: Waves crashed against the rocky shore all night
They walked along the shore collecting seashells

definitions: minister in charge of a Christian church or congregation
examples: The pastor delivered an inspiring sermon on Sunday morning
Our pastor visits sick members of the congregation

definitions: steep rock face, especially at the edge of the sea
examples: Eagles nested on the cliff overlooking the ocean
Hikers carefully navigated the path along the cliff

definitions: process of adding numbers or amounts together
person or thing added or joined to something
examples: Simple addition is taught in elementary mathematics
Check your addition to ensure the total is correct
The new addition to the team brings valuable experience
They built an addition to accommodate their growing family

definitions: person's usual work or profession that provides regular income
examples: Teaching has been her occupation for twenty years
Please state your occupation on the application form

definitions: thin, flat piece cut from something larger
examples: Would you like another slice of pizza?
She cut the bread into thick slices

definitions: organized armed forces of a country
examples: He served in the military for eight years
Military spending increased during the conflict

definitions: something that causes a specific reaction or response in an organism or system
examples: Light serves as a stimulus for plant growth
The economic stimulus package boosted consumer spending

definitions: government authority giving exclusive rights to an invention for a period
examples: The inventor filed a patent for her new device
Patent protection prevents others from copying the design

definitions: fine dry particles produced by grinding or crushing solid substances
examples: Add baking powder to make the cake rise
The powder dissolved quickly in warm water

definitions: complete disorder and confusion
examples: The sudden storm created chaos at the outdoor festival
Traffic chaos resulted from the highway accident

definitions: set of articles or equipment needed for a specific purpose
examples: The first aid kit contained bandages and antiseptic
She bought a model airplane kit to build

definitions: large keyboard musical instrument with wire strings struck by hammers
examples: She practiced piano for two hours every day
The grand piano dominated the concert hall stage

definitions: expert who studies human behavior and mental processes
examples: The psychologist helped patients cope with anxiety and depression
Child psychologists specialize in developmental issues

definitions: person employed to perform domestic duties in a household
examples: The wealthy family employed several servants in their mansion
Public servants work for government agencies

definitions: platform or compartment for raising and lowering people between floors
examples: Take the elevator to the tenth floor
The elevator stopped working during the power outage

definitions: action or process of transmitting something from one place to another
system of gears transmitting power from engine to wheels in vehicles
examples: Radio transmission was interrupted by the storm
Disease transmission can occur through contaminated water
The car's transmission needed expensive repairs
Manual transmission gives drivers more control

definitions: thicker end of something, especially a tool or weapon
person or thing that is an object of criticism or jokes
examples: He struck the nail with the butt of the hammer
The rifle butt rested against his shoulder
She became the butt of their cruel jokes
Don't make him the butt of your pranks

definitions: person who herds cattle, especially in the western United States
examples: The cowboy rode across the prairie checking on cattle
Cowboys gathered at the ranch for the roundup

definitions: intention or purpose behind an action or decision
examples: The intent of the law is to protect consumers
She questioned his intent in offering help

definitions: professional guidance to help resolve personal or psychological problems
examples: Marriage counseling helped them work through their issues
The school offers counseling services for stressed students

definitions: strong, regular pattern of movement or sound
examples: The drummer maintained a steady rhythm throughout the song
Dance to the rhythm of the music

definitions: state of having many interconnected parts or being difficult to understand
examples: The complexity of the problem required expert analysis
Modern technology increases in complexity every year

definitions: degree to which something produces a desired result or outcome
examples: Studies measured the effectiveness of the new treatment
The effectiveness of the campaign exceeded expectations

definitions: force tending to pull or stretch something to dangerous degree
particular breed, stock, or variety of organism
examples: The constant strain on the rope caused it to break
Work strain affected her physical and mental health
Scientists identified a new strain of the virus
This strain of wheat resists common diseases

definitions: waste material, especially unwanted food and household items
examples: Take the garbage out before it starts to smell
Garbage trucks collect waste every Tuesday morning

definitions: business enterprise involving considerable risk but potential profit
examples: The new venture required significant initial investment
Their joint venture expanded into international markets

definitions: mechanism for keeping a door or container fastened
examples: She turned the key in the lock to secure the door
The lock on the safe required a combination

definitions: assistant to an important person, especially a political leader
examples: The senator's aide scheduled all her appointments
Presidential aides briefed reporters on the decision

definitions: thin straight bar or stick made of wood, metal, or other material
examples: He used a fishing rod to catch trout in the stream
Curtain rods support the drapes across the window
